conclusion: To find the electromotive force (EMF) and internal resistance of the power supply, we can use the information given in the problem and the graph.
Point A corresponds to the maximum voltage (4 V) and minimum current (0.1 A).
Point B corresponds to the minimum voltage (1 V) and maximum current (0.6 A).
The EMF can be found from the intersection of the graph with the voltage axis when the current is zero. This is the maximum voltage the power supply can provide.
From the graph, the EMF (E) is 4.5 V.
The internal resistance can be calculated using the slope of the voltage vs. current graph.
Use the voltage and current values from points A and B to verify the calculation.
At point A: E = U1 + I1 * r
At point B: E = U2 + I2 * r
The electromotive force (EMF) of the power supply is 4.5 V.
The internal resistance of the power supply is 5 立.
